# play()

**Instance Method**

Plays audio asynchronously.

## Declaration

```swift
func play() -> Bool
```

## Return Value

[doc://com.apple.documentation/documentation/Swift/true] if playback starts successfully; otherwise, [doc://com.apple.documentation/documentation/Swift/false].

## Discussion

Calling this method implicitly calls [doc://com.apple.avfaudio/documentation/AVFAudio/AVAudioPlayer/prepareToPlay()] if the audio player is unprepared for playback.

## Controlling playback

- **prepareToPlay()**: Prepares the player for audio playback.
- **play(atTime:)**: Plays audio asynchronously, starting at a specified point in the audio output device’s timeline.
- **pause()**: Pauses audio playback.
- **stop()**: Stops playback and undoes the setup the system requires for playback.
- **isPlaying**: A Boolean value that indicates whether the player is currently playing audio.
